snippet: A second site on the East Coast won’t address the missile defense system’s basic weaknesses.
abstract: Editorial criticizes proposed East Coast missile defense site that would eventually cost some $3.6 billion; says it is premature and could actually harm America's national security by denying resources to other more urgently needed and more effective defense programs; holds current West Coast site has number of serious flaws that need to be addressed first.
lead_paragraph: A second site on the East Coast won’t address the missile defense system’s basic weaknesses.

headline.seo: Another Missile Defense System Is an Unnecessary Military Expense

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
